js.npmDescription: Base classes for kurento media server api

remoteClasses.name: MediaObject
remoteClasses.doc: Base for all objects that can be created in the media server.

properties.name: mediaPipeline
properties.doc: :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which this MediaObject belong, or the pipeline itself if invoked over a :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline`

properties.name: parent
properties.doc: parent of this media object. The type of the parent depends on the type of the element. The parent of a :rom:cls:`MediaPad` is its :rom:cls:`MediaElement`; the parent of a :rom:cls:`Hub` or a :rom:cls:`MediaElement` is its :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline`. A :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` has no parent, i.e. the property is null

properties.name: id
properties.doc: unique identifier of the mediaobject.

properties.name: childs
properties.doc: Childs of current object, all returned objects have parent set to current object

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Object name. This is just a comodity to simplify developers life debugging, it is not used internally for indexing nor idenfiying the objects. By default is the object type followed by the object id.

remoteClasses.name: ServerManager
remoteClasses.doc: This is a standalone object for managing the MediaServer

properties.name: info
properties.doc: Server information, version, modules, factories, etc

properties.name: pipelines
properties.doc: All the pipelines available in the server

properties.name: sessions
properties.doc: All active sessions in the server

remoteClasses.name: SessionEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Session based endpoint. A session is considered to be started when the media exchange starts. On the other hand, sessions terminate when a timeout, defined by the developer, takes place after the connection is lost.

remoteClasses.name: Hub
remoteClasses.doc: A Hub is a routing :rom:cls:`MediaObject`. It connects several :rom:cls:`endpoints <Endpoint>` together

remoteClasses.name: Filter
remoteClasses.doc: Base interface for all filters. This is a certain type of :rom:cls:`MediaElement`, that processes media injected through its sinks, and delivers the outcome through its sources.

remoteClasses.name: Endpoint
remoteClasses.doc:
Base interface for all end points. An Endpoint is a :rom:cls:`MediaElement`
that allow :term:`KMS` to interchange media contents with external systems,
supporting different transport protocols and mechanisms, such as :term:`RTP`,
:term:`WebRTC`, :term:`HTTP`, ``file:/`` URLs... An ``Endpoint`` may
contain both sources and sinks for different media types, to provide
bidirectional communication.

remoteClasses.name: HubPort
remoteClasses.doc: This :rom:cls:`MediaElement` specifies a connection with a :rom:cls:`Hub`

remoteClasses.name: PassThrough
remoteClasses.doc: This :rom:cls:`MediaElement` that just passes media through

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the element belongs

remoteClasses.name: UriEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Interface for endpoints the require a URI to work. An example of this, would be a :rom:cls:`PlayerEndpoint` whose URI property could be used to locate a file to stream

properties.name: uri
properties.doc: The uri for this endpoint.

remoteClasses.name: MediaPipeline
remoteClasses.doc: A pipeline is a container for a collection of :rom:cls:`MediaElements<MediaElement>` and :rom:cls:`MediaMixers<MediaMixer>`. It offers the methods needed to control the creation and connection of elements inside a certain pipeline.

remoteClasses.name: SdpEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Implements an SDP negotiation endpoint able to generate and process offers/responses and that configures resources according to negotiated Session Description

properties.name: maxVideoRecvBandwidth
properties.doc:
Maximum video bandwidth for receiving.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 500

methods.name: generateOffer
methods.doc:
Request a SessionSpec offer.

   This can be used to initiate a connection.

methods.name: processOffer
methods.doc: Request the NetworkConnection to process the given SessionSpec offer (from the remote User Agent)

params.name: offer
params.doc: SessionSpec offer from the remote User Agent

return.doc: The chosen configuration from the ones stated in the SDP offer

methods.name: processAnswer
methods.doc: Request the NetworkConnection to process the given SessionSpec answer (from the remote User Agent).

params.name: answer
params.doc: SessionSpec answer from the remote User Agent

return.doc: Updated SDP offer, based on the answer received.

methods.name: getLocalSessionDescriptor
methods.doc:
This method gives access to the SessionSpec offered by this NetworkConnection.

.. note:: This method returns the local MediaSpec, negotiated or not. If no offer has been generated yet, it returns null. It an offer has been generated it returns the offer and if an answer has been processed it returns the negotiated local SessionSpec.

methods.name: getRemoteSessionDescriptor
methods.doc:
This method gives access to the remote session description.

.. note:: This method returns the media previously agreed after a complete offer-answer exchange. If no media has been agreed yet, it returns null.

return.doc: The last agreed User Agent session description

remoteClasses.name: BaseRtpEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Base class to manage common RTP features.

properties.name: minVideoSendBandwidth
properties.doc:
Minimum video bandwidth for sending.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 100

properties.name: maxVideoSendBandwidth
properties.doc:
Maximum video bandwidth for sending.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 500

remoteClasses.name: MediaElement
remoteClasses.doc:
Basic building blocks of the media server, that can be interconnected through the API. A :rom:cls:`MediaElement` is a module that encapsulates a specific media capability. They can be connected to create media pipelines where those capabilities are applied, in sequence, to the stream going through the pipeline.

   :rom:cls:`MediaElement` objects are classified by its supported media type (audio, video, etc.)

methods.name: getSourceConnections
methods.doc: Get the connections information of the elements that are sending media to this element :rom:cls:`MediaElement`

params.name: description
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

return.doc: A list of the connections information that are sending media to this element. The list will be empty if no sources are found.

methods.name: getSinkConnections
methods.doc: Returns a list of the connections information of the elements that ere receiving media from this element.

params.name: description
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

return.doc: A list of the connections information that arereceiving media from this element. The list will be empty if no sinks are found.

methods.name: connect
methods.doc: Connects two elements, with the given restrictions, current :rom:cls:`MediaElement` will start emmit media to sink element. Connection could take place in the future, when both media element show capabilities for connecting with the given restrictions

params.name: sink
params.doc: the target :rom:cls:`MediaElement` that will receive media

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: the :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the pads that will be connected

params.name: sourceMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

params.name: sinkMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

methods.name: disconnect
methods.doc: Disconnects two elements, with the given restrictions, current :rom:cls:`MediaElement` stops sending media to sink element. If the previously requested connection didn't took place it is also removed

params.name: sink
params.doc: the target :rom:cls:`MediaElement` that will stop receiving media

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: the :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the pads that will be connected

params.name: sourceMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

params.name: sinkMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

methods.name: setAudioFormat
methods.doc: Sets the type of data for the audio stream. MediaElements that do not support configuration of audio capabilities will raise an exception

params.name: caps
params.doc: The format for the stream of audio

methods.name: setVideoFormat
methods.doc: Sets the type of data for the video stream. MediaElements that do not support configuration of video capabilities will raise an exception

params.name: caps
params.doc: The format for the stream of video

properties.name: version
properties.doc: MediaServer version

properties.name: modules
properties.doc: Descriptor of all modules loaded by the server

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Describes the type of mediaserver

properties.name: capabilities
properties.doc: Describes the capabilities that this server supports

complexTypes.name: ServerType
complexTypes.doc: Indicates if the server is a real media server or a proxy

properties.name: version
properties.doc: Module version

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Module name

properties.name: factories
properties.doc: Module available factories

complexTypes.name: MediaType
complexTypes.doc:
Type of media stream to be exchanged.
Can take the values AUDIO, DATA or VIDEO.

complexTypes.name: FilterType
complexTypes.doc:
Type of filter to be created.
Can take the values AUDIO, VIDEO or AUTODETECT.

complexTypes.name: VideoCodec
complexTypes.doc: Codec used for transmission of video.

complexTypes.name: AudioCodec
complexTypes.doc: Codec used for transmission of audio.

properties.name: numerator
properties.doc: the numerator of the fraction

properties.name: denominator
properties.doc: the denominator of the fraction

complexTypes.name: Fraction
complexTypes.doc: Type that represents a fraction of an integer numerator over an integer denominator

properties.name: codec
properties.doc: Audio codec

properties.name: bitrate
properties.doc: Bitrate

properties.name: codec
properties.doc: Video codec

properties.name: framerate
properties.doc: Framerate

properties.name: source
properties.doc: The source element in the connection

properties.name: sink
properties.doc: The sink element in the connection

properties.name: type
properties.doc: MediaType of the connection

properties.name: sourceDescription
properties.doc: Description of source media. Could be emty.

properties.name: sinkDescription
properties.doc: Description of sink media. Could be emty.

properties.name: object
properties.doc: :rom:cls:`MediaObject` where the error originated

properties.name: description
properties.doc: Textual description of the error

properties.name: errorCode
properties.doc: Server side integer error code

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Integer code as a String

events.name: Error
events.doc: An error related to the MediaObject has occurred

events.name: MediaSessionTerminated
events.doc: Event raised when a session is terminated. This event has no data.

events.name: MediaSessionStarted
events.doc: Event raised when a session starts. This event has no data.

properties.name: source
properties.doc: Object that raised the event

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Type of event that was raised

events.name: Media
events.doc: Base for all events raised by elements in the Kurento media server.

events.name: ObjectCreated
events.doc: Indicates that an object has been created on the mediaserver

properties.name: object
properties.doc: The object that has been created

events.name: ObjectDestroyed
events.doc: Indicates that an object has been destroyed on the mediaserver

properties.name: objectId
properties.doc: The id of the object that has been destroyed
